method: First calculate the mass of pure CaCO3 in the sample: mass(CaCO3) = 5.00 g × 84.0/100 = 4.20 g. Then calculate moles of CaCO3 using n = m/Mr: n(CaCO3) = 4.20 g / 100.1 g mol-1 = 0.04196 mol. From the reaction stoichiometry (1:1 ratio), moles of CO2 produced = moles of CaCO3 reacted = 0.04196 mol. Finally, calculate mass of CO2: mass = n × Mr = 0.04196 mol × 44.0 g mol-1 = 1.846 g, which rounds to 1.85 g to 3 significant figures.
